title: What would happen to stamp duty under a Corbyn government?
text:
Jeremy Corbyn’s approach to tax and rhetoric of redistribution has long made many Britons nervous.

For several years, since a Corbyn-led government has looked more likely, estate agents in tax perk destinations such as Jersey reported substantial increases in British buyer inquiries looking to up sticks and protect their wealth.

So, what could Corbyn mean for property taxes?

Say goodbye to stamp duty

When it comes to property, Labour policy is about more than money – it is about solving Britain’s shortage of affordable homes. As well as building, a Corbyn government would attempt to put an end to house price growth and try to free up housing stock. This kind of overhaul of the housing market...
description: Jeremy Corbyn’s approach to tax and rhetoric of redistribution has long made many Britons nervous.
